snippet: Based on its interviews of survivors who arrived in Reggio Calabria in southern Italy, Save the Children said that 400 people may have drowned.
abstract: Save the Children aid organization says 400 people may have drowned in capsizing of Reggio Calabria off Libyan coast; Italian coast guard helped rescue 144 people and has found nine bodies.
lead_paragraph: Based on its interviews of survivors who arrived in Reggio Calabria in southern Italy, Save the Children said that 400 people may have drowned.

headline.main: Italy: 400 May Have Drowned in Capsizing of Migrant Ship
headline.print_headline: Europe; Italy: 400 May Have Drowned in Capsizing of Migrant Ship
